course.subject: COMP
course.name: Database Management Systems
course.description: Principles of database systems; conceptual modeling and data models; logical and physical database design; query languages and query processing; database services including concurrency, crash recovery, security and integrity. Hands-on DBMS experience.
course.prerequisites: COMP 2011 OR COMP 2012 OR COMP 2012H
course.exclusions: COMP 5311, IEDA 3300, ISOM 3260

reviews.author: 2020survivor
reviews.comment_content:
1/4學期 ER diagram, Relationship
1/4學期 SQL
1/2學期 玄學 （= 四則運算的排列組合）

課程本身沒問題 全世界的大學都是上一樣課綱吧我猜

勸世文：
If: 你他媽超級無敵確定自己對資料庫有興趣 AND 你以前寫過sql 並且每次寫sql的時候都會寫到高潮
ELSE: 請不要因為「好奇」來上這門課 這門課真的幹你娘非常非常非常無聊

教授的slides 就跟劃上重點的字典沒兩樣 課程內容雖然真的介紹很多很實在 但我相信cs的各位不會甘願投入大學歲月苦讀字典或六法全書吧？前半段課程sql er diagram還好 普通無聊而已 後半段課程真的一大堆超級抽象的資料庫搜索理論 並且不像數學課理論都會給你證明 是那種要靠自己想像力證明+想像力理解+超能力死背的scheme, protocol, algorithm 真的已經2020年了 真心勸告迷惘的同學們 不要浪費時間上這門課 完全不值得

喔對上文提到algorithm 如果你上過3711 我必須告訴你 此algorithm和3711那種algorithm天差地遠 3711至少在訓練思考上面真的很有趣 這裡的algortihm真的就是玄學 你完全不知道自己在幹嘛 也沒辦法像3711借助code 或者是真實存在的例子去圖像化 並且實踐自己的algorithm 3311完完全全是在「湊答案」 舉例：有時pipeline是對的 有時pipeline你就pipe到自己的屁眼 還有我到最後都不知道merge join在join三小 到底為什麼第一個run可以做到自己sort 更不用說hash join更是迷到爆炸 最後考試有種把字典裡的公式拿來佛系代一代 真的這堂課一點屁用都沒有 拜託除非你是真的知道database在幹嘛的db兒 要不然別來
reviews.comment_teaching:
教授教的非常用心 人真的非常好

但真的他媽課程就是超級無聊 我後半學期沒有一堂課都是不困惑的 用zoom上課 教授問大家有沒有問題 我猜全班的人大概也都陣亡一半了吧 問題多到不知道怎麼問 啊就玄學到底我要問什麼？問玄學答玄學 造成教授和學生的困擾

教授也是挺可憐的 他人真的很好 但因為這課程真的無聊到死 他也教學的很吃力 到後面他的教學根本失去熱情了吧 拜託Fred 教授很老了 讓這個榮譽教授去退休吧 別修這堂課了放他去退休吧
reviews.comment_grading:
爛吧 別說了 就是爛

課程無聊 消磨對思考的熱情 浪費大學青春 還送你一個不怎麼樣的grade 你都看到這邊了真的還想上這堂課？
reviews.comment_workload:
偏多
每堂課都有作業 11.pm前要交
每堂lab都有作業 11.pm前要交
每堂tut都有作業 11.pm前要交

然後咧... 你以為訓練很多 最後觀念都會懂嗎 錯了 從頭到尾都是在靠賽 到後面教授也說了全班都沒有人作業寫出正確答案

拜託看到這邊了 就請你別上這堂課了

reviews.author: Luweegee
reviews.title: VERY TOUGH COURSE 😩😩😩😩
reviews.comment_content:
DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE IF YOU'LL NOT WORK WITH DATABASES IN THE FUTURE! This course is very tough, very time-consuming and I DON'T recommend taking this for fun!! There are other fun things you can do with your life 🙂

(🔥 = Difficult/Confusing)
1️⃣ ER Model & Database Design
2️⃣ Relational Model
   🔹 Reduction of ER model
   🔥🔥 2NF, 3NF, BCNF
3️⃣ Relational Algebra
4️⃣ SQL
   🔹 Basic operations
   🔹 Aggregate functions
   🔹 DDL & DML
[📝 Mid-term]
5️⃣ Storage & File Structure
6️⃣ Indexing
   🔹 Single & multi-level indexing
   🔹 B+ tree index
   🔥 Hash index
7️⃣ Query Processing
   🔹 Selection cost & external sorting
   🔥 Join cost
   🔹 Projection, set operation cost
8️⃣🔥🔥 Query Optimization
9️⃣ Transactions & Concurrency Control
   🔹 Serializability
   🔹 Two-phased locking systems
   🔹 Timestamp protocols
🔟 Database Recovery
NoSQL Databases (not tested in final)
[📝 Final (cumulative)]

The first half of the course (before MT) is highly practical. It first teaches you the ER Model (similar to class diagrams in COMP3111) and how to extract information from a problem statement. Then, it teaches you the Relational Model, ie. converting the "class" diagram into different tables. Finally, there are 3 lessons on Oracle SQL where you learn how to make queries, create tables and insert table data.

However, the second half of the course is a LIVING HELL since everything is theoretical. You'll learn the data structures and algorithms used behind database management system and it's difficult as fuck 😪. The query optimization part is the most difficult and confusing since there're endless possibilities to evaluate a query and you need to provide the most optimized plan to process it. Most of the time I don't know what the fuck I'm doing 😩😩😩😩
reviews.comment_teaching:
TLDR: Professor is a nice guy with very fluent English. However, he basically SPEEDRUNS every lesson since there are too much content to cover and around 70% of the time you'll feel completely lost and confused at the end of the lecture 😫😫

📃 Teaching Style
He's fine in explaining the concepts on the slides and sometimes he emphasizes on some tricky parts and concepts. He is also very responsive to student's questions in Zoom (this semester is online due to COVID) and he can answer all the questions relatively quickly. However, every lesson is packed with rich content and he loves teaching at an INSANELY FAST speed, which is IMPOSSIBLE to catch up unless you're a genius. Every lesson feels like a world-record speedrun attempt and I usually get completely lost at around half way though the lesson 😪😪

The craziest lecture is lecture 5 on 2NF, 3NF and BCNF. Someone on YouTube has made a 6 hour playlist on the exact same content but the professor managed to cram all of that in a 1.5 hour lesson 😈. Just watch this playlist instead: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLdo5W4Nhv31b33kF46f9aFjoJPOkdlsRc

📃 Teaching Materials
The teaching materials are well designed in general. Each lecture has its own lecture slide, in-class worksheet and a worksheet solution (released at the next lesson), and they are well designed. However, the slides are a bit confusing to understand for the second half of the course.

📃 Tutorials & Labs
The "teaching" in tutorials is kinda shitty since the TA just reads out the tutorial slides and the exercise solutions. The labs exercises are pretty useful for you to practice writing SQL and PL/SQL though.
reviews.comment_grading:
TLDR: Quite good grade. Totally not expecting to get an A-

🔹 Lecture, tutorial & lab exercises - 10%
   🔸 (Grade by effort)
🔹 Project - 30%
   🔸 Task 1: ER schema design (10%)
   🔸 Task 2: SQL table creation & queries (10%)
   🔸 Task 3: Information system implementation (10%)
🔹 Open book MT (2hr) - 20%
🔹 Open book Final (3hr) - 40%

📈Statistics:
Project Task 1: Mean = 8.1/10
Project Task 2: Mean = 7.9/10
Project Task 3: Mean = 8.8/10
MT: Mean = 66.5/100 ; SD = 15.5
Final: Mean = 59.1/100 ; SD = 16.3

I got full marks in lecture exercises, 26.5/30 marks in the project, +0.35 SD in mid-term and +0.88 SD in final. I got an A- at the end, which is totally out of my expectation. I feel like most of the students are confused with the course material so the mean is not unusually high 😛.
reviews.comment_workload:
TLDR: Feels like a 4-credits course. Shit ton of things to be submitted and requires lots of time to revise and study 😪😪😪.

📝Lesson, tutorial and lab exercises
This is fucking insane. We need to complete and submit a worksheet (1 or 2 pages) for every lesson, tutorial and lab (9 labs in total) at 11pm within the same date. These exercises can take from 5~10 minutes to as long as 1 hour to complete if you're answering them seriously. Since everyone get lost at the end of the lecture, you're forced to revise the lecture slides within the same day in order to know how to do those exercises and this is very time consuming.

📝Project
The project is also very time-consuming and each task takes me around 7~10 hours to complete. The first task is to draw an ER model based on a problem statement, which is quite difficult since you need to pay attention to many small details. The second task is even more annoying since you need to go through the problem statement multiple times in order to extract all the constraints that needed to be set when defining the tables in SQL. The third task is a little bit better, but we still need to write 40 short to medium SQL queries in a C# file.

📝Mid-term and Final
Since I got confused in almost every lesson, I need to spend a shit ton of time to revise the lecture slides when preparing for the mid-term and final exam. The final exam is also cumulative so I need to spend extra time revising for the first half of the course.

In summary, this feels like a 4-credits course. In fact, I've completed several 4-credits course like COMP2012, COMP3111 and MATH2411 and NONE of these courses have higher workload than this course

reviews.author: ys101
reviews.title: A course that you should take it during exchange
reviews.comment_content: Only 3 lessons on SQL. I have learnt it so I do pretty well on mid-term. The content before midterm was make sense. However, the content after midterm was 3 or 4 times before the midterm. Most of the content you would not use again, except you want to be a database manager in the future. This content was not just about SQL, it covered most of the materials in cs, like comp2611, comp3511, c++, networking, web, java. You take one course, you can gain 10 courses' knowledge. I think the huge different style before and after midterm was because the textbook. This guy chose two different  textbooks and the styles of them were totally different. He just copied and pasted the content from the textbook to his ppt so it made the style quite different after midterm. Most of the topic on final, like PL/SQL and database API and web API, he even did not teach them or just skip them. However, the questions were very difficult in the final exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: This guy was even worse than Dekai. This is not a joke. He just read the ppt every lesson and rushed very fast after midterm since the content was like a 5-credits course. Sometime, I asked him some questions, but he even could not answer me correctly. If you do not trust me how bad he was, just do it!!!! just do it!!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
Since this semester conducted online exam, so the SQL part would directly run by machine, no any marks for your steps. You would got 0 if your SQL cannot compile on his machine. Thus, this was quite unfair because everyone might have typo in his/her code. I got full mark in the 4 assignments and attendance, 9x/100 in midterm and 7x/100 in final (the final was extremely difficult).
The above is what I have typed before releasing the grade and I want to give it another E on grading orginally (If you have seen other reviews in other semesters, you would know how bad the grade was). But honestly, I got A+ finally. Then, I think giving it a B on grading is quite fair. However, you cannot take this as a consideration. I think he gave all of us very good grade on this semester because of online teaching. I believe I can only get A- at most at the regular term. You should take some reviews in other semesters as a consideration.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is very light. The good thing is you don't need to do too much but the bad thing is obvious. You would not have chance to do practice as the assignment could only cover around 5% of the materials after the mid-term (only 1 pa after midterm but the content was 3 times before). He would post some self-practice exercise on his website, I finished them all and the exercise in tutor but I think this was still not enough.

reviews.author: chauchau123
reviews.title: 爛grade之王
reviews.comment_content: 內容幾豐富, mid term前教你database點運作, 點跟query去select data, mid term後就多d theory野, 教你點計search cost之類, 最重係有教你sql language, 作為it人學多種language都唔錯
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor 採用一般comp course沉悶式教法, 但算教得清楚易明, 但有部分lab ta 有極重口音, 重到聽唔明佢講咩果隻, teaching materials內容豐富值得一讚, 除左lecture notes, 仲有exercise同tutorial slides, 提供極多examples, 唔明睇到你明
reviews.comment_grading: 可能係所有comp course入面最爛grade, 除非你唔care gpa/好有信心拎高分, 否則上佢個course website download materials落黎自修好過, 我所有assignment above mean, mid term above 0.5sd, final above 10分(冇release sd), 最後拎個c+
reviews.comment_workload: Comp course黎講算少workload, 有兩份written assignments, 基本上一個鐘內搞掂, 仲有兩份programming assignments, 自己做好簡單, 但由於好似幾年內冇update過, 所以...

reviews.author: lim
reviews.title: If you want to learn database, please take the course when teaching by this professor
reviews.comment_content:
ER Diagram
Relational Model
Relational Algebra
SQL
RDB Design
-------------Midterm---------------
Storage and Indexing
Query Processing
Query Optimization
Transaction Management
Accessing Databases (NOT include in final)
Database Security

Other Database Topics (NOT include in final)
-Data Warehousing
-Distributed Databases
-NoSQL
-High-Dimensional Data Management
-DB and ML

The content of this course is really huge, it is just like two course combining each other, you really need some time to understand it. Also, boring is definitely a problem when having too much information.

For the final, in past paper, you will see some question which is so called 玄學 (metaphysics by google translate) like calculating cost, join in QEP. However, for this professor, as what he said, his final exam does not require calculator. He doesn't require us to calculate join/select cost. He just ask for the principle and formula of the join which already teach us in tutorial and lecture. For query optimization, what you need is assumption base on the rule in notes, not imagination. His final exam is really better than other professor design since every question is reasonable.

But there are still some problems in the course. The answer of final and midterm exercise is not released. How do we know are there any mistake when the TA revising the examination papers? Also, the exam format is change before an hour of final. We suddenly require to finish the exam in word. However, a question require us to use some symbol and we don't know how to type it. This is so bad and I hope it won't happen again.
reviews.comment_teaching: This is the fist time of this professor to teach. His teaching quality is general. Usually read the slides and provides some exercises or questions to us. One thing I think is really good is his summarizing skill, he will use short sentences or point form to explain some difficult concept. (you cannot google these sentences so it is really summarizes by himself)
reviews.comment_grading:
Weekly exercises (10%)
Four individual assignments: 30%
Midterm test: 20% change to Mid-term exercise: 10% because of online mode, mean = 8.56/10
Final exam: 50%, mean = 62.5/100

The scheme is basically depend on final since everyone get high score on the assignment and exercise. However, I would say that the grading is excellent. I have never seen a COMP course providing such a good grade.

A - 15% B - 40% C - 40% D/F 5%
You can see that this professor has maximized the B range. If you are lucky, it is possible that you can get B- even below mean while other COMP course professor gives you C+ even if you above mean. Also, C range is maximum by combining D and F together so if you really bad at final, you can still get C or C-
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is very light, the four assignment is easy and you can do it in few hours.

The Midterm exercise need to finish during 28 hours but I think that it won't occur anymore.

The weekly exercises is help you to understand the course materials. Since professor doesn't want to give us too many workload, you can obtain the score by just submitting the exercise. Also, the answer is released with the exercise and explain in tutorial so if you are busy, you can just copy the answer try to understand it when you are free.

reviews.author: JamesWU
reviews.comment_content:
Covered about 80% chapters of the textbook - Database System Concepts, 7th edition. This could help you have a basic understanding of how to use DBMS (database management system) and how it internally works. Topics include:

- Database Design (E-R Model and Relational Model)
- Relational Language (Relational Algebra and SQL)
-------Midterm--------
- Storage Management and Indexing
- Query Processing and Optimization
- Transaction Control
-------Final------------
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Lochovsky is nice and patient and he will reply to your email in a short time (probably on the same day). I guess he is a native English speaker so the teaching is clear and easy to understand. TA is nice and willing to answer your questions too.

The teaching speed before midterm is moderate. But after midterm it may be a bit fast as there are so many knowledges to teach in each lecture. You probably cannot totally understand it just during the lectures and it is advisable to pre-view or review notes after midterm.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not sure whether it is good or bad grade. Some stat for reference:

- Midterm (20%): Mean 75.2/100 SD ~12 (I forgot) High 97
- Final (40%): Mean 66.17/100 SD 14.3 High 89.75
- Project (3 Task, each task 10%): Mean for each task is 7~8
- Lecture Exercise, Tutorial & Lab (10%): Almost everybody get nearly full mark as long as you submit it

I got 1 SD above mean in midterm and 1.5 SD above mean in final, project a bit above mean. Finally got A+.

Exam is open-book but understanding is very important. It is not necessary to understand all the materials in notes just for exam as some of them will not be tested. However, I think you should understand all the exercises (including lecture exercises and tutorials) if you want to get good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
A bit great for summer. I need to spend the whole class day - in the morning and afternoon attending class, in the evening doing lecture exercises, tutorials and labs. The DDL of them is 11pm on the same day of class so you cannot do it another day. Fortunately, you just have 2 class day in a week.

Each of the 3 project task requires additional 1-2 day if you want to get high marks. But you can easily finish it in half day to get average marks.

reviews.author: USTstudentA
reviews.comment_content: Before midterm, the course is about relation and SQL. After midterm, it's about query processing and query optimization.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof is very responsible and he always replies email almost immediately. The feedback of exercises, tasks, and exams are very timely. The PPT, exercise, and exercise solution have some minor problems. Though they do not affect the understanding of the basic concepts, it causes some trouble. And if you do not point them out and double-check with prof, you might never know there're some problems with the materials, which is misleading. In order to be on schedule, prof sometimes just briefly explain some materials. I still need to digest the content a lot after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Unknown.
10% exercise
10% on each project (30% in total)
20% midterm
40% final
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is huge for a summer course. We have lectures on Tuesday and Thursday. On the days having lectures, we need to hand-in two in-class exercises, one tutorial exercise, and one lab exercise. The content is so much that it is quite hard to catch up. Besides the exercises, we need to finish three projects, which are based on lab materials. The final is cumulative, so the review is also not easy.

reviews.author: CyrusL
reviews.comment_content:
[Topics]
- Entity-Relationship (E-R) Model and Database Design
- Relational Model and Relational Database Design
- Relational Algebra (RA)
- Structured Query Language (SQL)*
- Functional Dependencies*
--- Midterm Test ---
- Storage and File Structure
- Indexing
- Query Processing*
- Query Optimization*
- Transactions
- Concurrency Control
- Recovery System
--- Final Exam ---

Topics marked with an asterisk (*) are the ones you really have to look out for; they are relatively difficult and make up a good portion of the exams.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The PowerPoint slides are very well-designed; you can learn 90% of the course just by reading them.

The professor explains the concepts in great detail and is more than happy to answer questions during and off-class. He also periodically issues surveys to check on our progress and receive feedback on the course, which is a great plus.
reviews.comment_grading:
[Grading Scheme]
- Lecture, Tutorial and Lab Exercises (10%)
Lecture and tutorial exercises are handed out during almost every class and are normally due by the end of class. Some of them are done individually but most have to be done with another student; otherwise, only half credit will be given. Lab exercises are released during lab and are due by 11 pm on the same day.

Grading is based on effort. You can get either full credit, half credit or zero credit for each exercise.

- Projects (30%)
There are three projects, each taking up 10% of the final grade. The projects have a common theme and are progressive, meaning that each project builds upon the previous one. Do not worry; a sample project is given so that you will not have to rely on your own work.

- Midterm Test (20%) & Final Exam (40%)
These cover all of the previous lecture content. The final exam places emphasis on the latter half of the course though.

[My Grades]
Exercises: 100/100 (Mean: 92.5)
Projects: 281/300 (Mean: 258.0)
Midterm Test: 90.0/100 (Mean: 77.4)
Final Exam: 92.0/100 (Mean: 71.8)
Overall: 92.9% (Grade: A)

It is quite difficult to achieve A+ in this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Exercises: You are supposed to complete all of them during class, so the take-home workload is minimal.

Projects: The SQL statements can be a debugging nightmare, but otherwise they are quite straightforward. Each project will not take you more than a full day's work.

reviews.author: Kenneth
reviews.title: The course is 50% useful
reviews.comment_content:
I would say, the course can be mainly separated into two parts: how to use database (mid-term exam) and what is database (final exam).
"How to use database" teaches database relations (ER diagram, relational algebra, SQL statements, etc. I would say this part is super useful, as we may have a high chance in using database or design a database relation in our jobs.
"What is database" teaches database memory allocation, optimization, etc. I think this part is completely useless. You will need to learn this if you want to make a database, but I don't think this is really necessary, as there are so many existing database software (like mySQL).
reviews.comment_teaching: Wilfred seems to be good, but I already skipped lecture after 2 weeks.
reviews.comment_grading: As I am super interested in the first part of the course (mid-term), so I almost got full mark (above more than 1.5 sd) in mid-term. However, as I am completely bored with the second part, I got poor result in final (below more than 1 sd). I got overall B-.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is acceptable. Assignment may cost sometime to finish (especially the last assignment about the SQL program). It may take more than one day to finish an assignment. But I think it is pretty useful, because it involves the real use of database (SQL).

reviews.author: flora liu
reviews.comment_content: 不是很实用，ER图讲了很久，半个学期都在算page cost，找工作基本用不上
reviews.comment_teaching: PPT很详细，老师讲课也基本上读PPT，不去上课也完全OK，看PPT就行。其实内容全部来源于参考书目。
reviews.comment_grading: 按照rank给分。老师不讲武德，说好大作业写了就给80%的分数，结果平均分都只有六七分。虽然给分标准很详细，但是很迷。final的难度比作业高，而且时间很紧。
reviews.comment_workload: 一周有两天都耗在这门课，每周两个小作业，每个月一个大作业，超级超级超级耗时间。

reviews.author: kcy240
reviews.title: 痛苦但算靚Grade
reviews.comment_content:
睇其他


如果你純粹想學SQL嘅話建議自學，因為呢個course得前半部分係關於SQL，後半部分就係所謂嘅玄學
reviews.comment_teaching:
prof個人幾nice同和藹，每堂都會summarize一次上一堂講過嘅野，教得幾detail，但有時臨落堂會rush

比C主要原因唔係佢教得唔好，係佢個lecture note難睇程度唔低過3111同3511。份note極多字同啲零零碎碎嘅example (有啲仲要冇比答案)。一啲需要理解嘅Algorithm又唔會好似3711咁比大量圖你run一次比你睇，淨比個文字步驟你。我到考完final都唔知要點run，淨記左個cost點計，完全唔知條式點黎。以下附上一個其他學校嘅external sort lecture note
https://pages.cs.wisc.edu/~paris/cs564-s18/lectures/lecture-16.pdf
人哋嗰個external sort係易理解勁多，我哋就要自己想象

Lab同Tutorial冇上過唔知教成點
Tutorial主要係比exercise你做，for你個assignments同final，但我覺得練習太少
Lab主要係教你打SQL，比較實際，同個考試完全冇關係，但對個Assignment4有用
reviews.comment_grading:
15% A range
40% B range

Assignment1 8%
Assignment2 6%
Assignment3 8%
Assignment4 8%
Weekly exercises 10%
Mid-term Exercise 10%
Final 50%

42% (final) + 49.5% (other) -> A
reviews.comment_workload:
Assginment啲Task本身唔難，但實際做起上黎有好多其他bug要搞
Assignment3 SQL段code好快搞掂，但要用好多時間入個資料
Assignment4 SQL + UI 都係好快搞掂，但加reference嗰到係咁出bug (改唔到佢地要個版本)，最終send email叫TA事後幫手改版本

自己final準備左成10日有突
就算佢cut完範圍都仲係好多野要溫，exercise又少，past paper得一份，好多野都要靠自己摸索自己估，溫書難度極高，mid-term打後嘅content溫完都唔知溫緊咩，個過程真係好痛苦

reviews.author: elwc
reviews.title: Not a bad summer course
reviews.comment_content:
A Simple Introduction to DBMS
ER Model
Relational Model
Relational Algebra
SQL
-------------Midterm---------------
Storage and File Structure
Indexing
Query Processing
Query Optimization
Transactions
Concurrency Control
Database Recovery
NoSQL Databases

Although there are a few mistakes in the lecture notes, overall the lecture notes are well-designed. The content before midterm should be easier.

Most of the topics appeared in lectures will be in the exams. Tutorials just repeat the lecture content right after the lecture ends. Labs are not included in the exams. Attendance is not mandatory. The reference book is not mandatory.

You need to complete a worksheet after each lecture, tutorial and lab and submit on that day.

These worksheets are easy. They will be graded on efforts instead of correctness so full marks for sure. Very similar problems will also be demonstrated on class.

Skipping class is not a good idea. You don't get to watch the lecture videos shortly after the class. If you skip one, you probably can only rely on the lecture notes to complete the exercise before the day ends.
reviews.comment_teaching: Normal teaching. But sometimes the professor gets annoyed when there are quite many questions on zoom. He may just tell you to revise the previous ppt or give a unclear answer.
reviews.comment_grading:
1. Lecture, Tutorial and Lab Exercises 10%
2. Project 30%
Task 1 - Entity-Relationship Schema Design 10%
Task 2 - Table Creation and SQL Queries 10%
Task 3 - Implementation 10%
3. Midterm Test 20%
4. Final Exam 40%
reviews.comment_workload:
8 worksheets per week but most of them are easy and you will have enough time to finish them on that day.

The three tasks in the project require much more time. You may need 2 days to complete it and spend so much time to debug and improve your work.

reviews.author: Kabul
reviews.title: Finally a real introductory course...
reviews.comment_content:
Very hands-on and practical. We've got to learn how to manage a relational database from design to implementation using Oracle. While DBMS technology is actually quite old, it's still very widely used in a lot of companies and I'm sure most of us would find it useful.

The highlight of the course is definitely SQL. Don't underestimate its difficulty - SQL grammar is simple, but its usage is tricky. The logic of formulating SQL is often not that trivial and requires some little twists or tricks.

After the midterm, the content then moves to the physical level of the database. This part is more theoretical and conceptually demanding. Basic understanding in algorithms and data structures such as binary trees, B+ trees and hashing would help.

Wilfred also introduced NoSQL this year. But due to time limitation, not much implementation could be taught. If you're interested, you can move on self-learning and playing around the more trendy technologies like MongoDB and Hadoop.

1️⃣ Introduction to DBMS
2️⃣ ER Model
3️⃣ Relational Algebra
4️⃣ SQL
      🔶 DDL, DML
      🔶 PL/SQL, Cursors, Triggers
5️⃣ Normalization
      🔶 3NF
      🔶 BCNF
6️⃣ Physical File Organization
      🔶 Indexing
      🔶 Query Optimizer
      🔶 RAID
7️⃣ Transaction Management
      🔶 ACID Properties
      🔶 Recovery
      🔶 Concurrency Control
8️⃣ NoSQL Databases
      🔶 BASE Principles
      🔶 MapReduce
9️⃣ Database APIs
      🔶 ODBC

This is a real introductory course - you're only expected to have basic C++ programming and algorithm background, which I think are reasonable. I've seen so many other courses that unrealistically expected us to have already learned the thing in order to take the course. Ridiculous. This course, while still difficult, has a much more manageable learning curve. You don't need to know DBMS beforehand in order for you to take this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Not quite sure why so many students bitch about Wilfred's teaching (because he gives bad grades?) I personally love his teaching - He's very beginner-friendly, starting from the basic and walking through with you all the necessary steps. (I also took his Java course in my year 1) He's deffo a lot better than the usual type of professors that treats everyone as genii and casually skips details in explanation.

悶唔悶其次，起碼聽得明。

The 2 Indian tutorial TAs are quite good. They can explain things in a fluent and logical manner. But some lab TAs have lots of rooms for improvement. It's not nice if the TAs have a monotonic soft voice and deliver in a way as if they're just talking to themselves.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got 70/100 in the midterm and 94/100 in the final. Fucked up assignment 3 scoring only 71/100, but did okay in the other 3.

💯 Final grade: A

其實都唔係咁爛 grade 姐……
reviews.comment_workload:
✏️💻 30% 4 Assignments (5% + 5% + 10% + 10%)
✏️ 30% Midterm
✏️ 40% Final

The first 2 are written assignments - pretty simple and can be finished in about 1 or 2 hours each. The 3rd assignment is on SQL, including database definition and writing complex queries. The 4th one is a C++ programming assignment on ODBC. These 2 programming assignments will take you longer time and make sure you've got enough test cases to check for the robustness.

The marking on the assignments is quite strict. You either get full marks or 0 in each task. Usually no partial credits will be given.

Overall the workload is manageable.

reviews.author: Teddy
reviews.title: Interesting course with a good professor
reviews.comment_content:
1) E-R diagram
- Relationship of different objects
- Easy to understand, but the questions in exams are very hard

2) SQL
- Computer Language to select datum
- Logical things, but the application is hard in lab (Assignments and lab exercises)

3) Indexing
- Finding datum with indexing method
- Little bit hard to understand, but the questions are easier than other topics

4) Query Processing
- Writing datum to disk and find its cost
- Quite hard to understand
reviews.comment_teaching:
Best Professor Ever!
- He can clearly explain the concepts.
- He is also very funny.
- All materials including lecture videos can be found on internet.
- He teaches too fast since there is too much things to teach
reviews.comment_grading:
Still okay since I failed my tasks and finals.

Attendance: 10%
Tasks: 10%
Midterm: 30%
Final: 50%
(That's what I remember)

Attendance: (Lecture+Tutorial): 76.32 (mean: 75.7)
Midterm: 73.5 (mean: 71.9)
Task 1: 65 (mean: 65.2)
Task 2: 38 (mean: 77.5)
Task 3: 9 (mean: 71)
Final: 48.2 (mean: 65.6)

Grade: C-
reviews.comment_workload:
- You have to take attendance of the lecture, tutorial and lab.
- You have to do exercises with a partner in almost every lecture and tutorial.
- The tasks are difficult for me since I don't know how to use the required softwares, so you have to attend the lab and the TA will teach and help you.

reviews.author: Celia_cmh
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus:
Entity-Relationship (E-R) Model and Database Design
Relational Model and Relational Database Design
Relational Algebra
Structured Query Language (SQL)
Functional Dependencies
Storage Management
Indexing and Hashing
Query Processing
Query Optimization
Transaction Management
Concurrency Control
Database Recovery

呢一科係學database嘅運作
而唔係單單SQL
如果將來做野係想玩data果邊
呢個course可以幫你打好個底
知道點用點設計同Running Cost
reviews.comment_teaching:
教授好好人
如果下一年summer 有開嘅話 教授話會安排考試係下午舉行
上堂落堂佢都好樂意解答問題
每堂都會有exercise
佢係預你即堂交 但如果個堂剩低時間唔多就會變下堂交
交左professor會親自幫你改
Lecture Exercise 唔會理你錯幾多 有交就有分
Tutorial Exercise 就會計你岩大部分先有 不過後期內容太難都點都會照比分 好似係
LAB比較輕鬆 唔識都可以GOOGLE到要用嘅SQL
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:
Lecture, Tutorial and Lab Exercises 10%
Project (3 Tasks) 30% in Total (each task 10%)
Midterm 20%
Final 40%

midterm exam都冇人滿分
project想aim 滿分嘅加油啦
做得好認真都只係踩mean / 高D咁
de晒bug都攞唔到滿分
唔知點先可以攞高分啦
佢話就話冇attendance 但有worksheet計你participation咁
個人grade: B+
(midterm above 0.9sd; final above 0.5sd)
reviews.comment_workload:
一星期上4堂 2 tutor 2 lab比較chur 係用足兩日full day咁濟
我有返埋工 所以覺得時間唔夠用
建議報多一個course或者炒散算
一路intern一路讀嘅話會跟唔上
但做個廢青咁讀 再每個禮拜都溫下書就輕鬆讀

reviews.author: Dicaprio
reviews.title: need attendance to almost all lectures, tutorials and labs
reviews.comment_content:
TueThur
11:00~12:30 Lecture, lecture exercise due 14:30 same day
12:30~13:30 Tuturial, tutorial exercise due 23:00 same day
13:30~14:30 lunch
14:30~16:00 Lecture, lecture exercise due 23:00 same day
16:00~17:00 Lab, lab due 23:00 same day

Although there might be pdf version of the lecture, tutorial exercise on the course webpage, but if they forgot to upload, you can only do the paper version face to face.

lab only publishes at most 1 day before. hard to install so I recommend doing it in ust cse lab

Lecture topics:
Database Management Systems
-- Introduction to database, nothing special
Entity-Relationship (E-R) Model and Database Design
-- drawing ER diagram after reading comprehension of the question
Relational Algebra (RA)
-- another expression of SQL
Structured Query Language (SQL)
-- select from where ...
Relational Database Design
-- how to reduce redundancy but keeps functional dependency
*** Midterm test everything above ***
Storage and File Structure
-- how data is saved and retrieved(a little bit comp 2611)
Indexing
-- many different ways to reduce page I/O cost of retrieving data
Query Processing
-- highly related to indexing
Query Optimization
-- if you fail indexing and query processing, you cant understand anything here
Transactions
-- finally new easy things
Concurrency Control
-- how to run multiple programs at the same time while making sure everything reads and write in correct order
Recovery System
-- how to undo or redo after something crashes
*** Final test everything above ***
NoSQL Databases
-- not graded, yay
reviews.comment_teaching:
lectures not sleepy because you need to do the lecture exercises

tutorials are boring because he is just repeating what we just learned in the lecture right before the tutorial.

labs: no one is listening to what the TA is saying. everyone just doing the lab as quickly as possible and go home.
reviews.comment_grading:
1. Lecture, Tutorial and Lab Exercises 10%
2. Project 30%
Task 1 - Entity-Relationship Schema Design 10%
Task 2 - Relational Table Creation and SQL Queries 10%
Task 3 - Information System Query Implementation 10%
3. Midterm Test Jul. 13, 11:00-12:30 20%
4. Final Exam Aug. 10, 1:00-4:00 40%

Open notes, open Canvas, open code editor midterm and final exam. they hand out and take back the questions(paper) one at a time.
Final schedule:
13:00~13:18 Question 1(10 points) (collect at 13:23)
13:18~13:36 Question 2(10 points) (13:16 hand out, 13:41 collect)
13:36~13:54 Question 3(10 points) (13:34 hand out, 13:59 collect)
13:54~14:48 Question 4(30 points) (13:52 hand out, 14:53 collect)
14:48~15:24 Question 5(20 points) (14:46 hand out, 15:29 collect)
15:24~16:00 Question 6(20 points) (15:22 hand out, 16:05 collect)
last question is on paper + writing SQL using computer and hand in to Canvas (both midterm and final)
reviews.comment_workload:
workload a bit high because every lecture, tutorial, lab have things to do. although most of them can be completed within lecture time.

lecture topics are related to each other so if you dont understand one, it is a bit hard to understand the next few lectures

labs might be hard and might take more time than the 1 hour lab session

Project task 1:  read 2 pages of English words and draw a ER diagram. Just took less than 1 hour to draw but a lot more time to think if i missed anything or not. thinking if my common sense = professor's common sense or not

Project task 2: creating tables and constraints for a given task 1 answer. more straight forward but easily miss some constraints. ChatGPT can help you do 80% of the work. 2~3 hours i think?

Project task 3: writing 42 sqls for a C# webpage. 3 hours to write, and another 3 to test. too few screenshots were given to test. So we must attend lab to use TA's model answer to compare our output result.

reviews.author: uue
reviews.title: 不建议选
reviews.comment_content:
教的内容很基础，er图，sql语句，IO cost
感觉是本科水平的教学内容
大部分精力花在了完全不知道有什么用的IO cost计算上
最后一节课说到大家感兴趣的nosql db却只是一带而过放视频
reviews.comment_teaching: 非常平淡，引人入睡
reviews.comment_grading:
每节课后都有exercise，写了就有满分
三次assignment，给分很烂，尤其IO cost，意义不明的复杂题目，一百个人能有一百个答案
考试给分还行
reviews.comment_workload: assignment很折磨人

reviews.author: AXV
reviews.comment_content: Not cover the modern database system that are used by industrial company, but focus on basic computation
reviews.comment_teaching: Good, prof had tried his best to teach us, while TA is not very friendly, and almost not permit students to argue their grade.
reviews.comment_grading: Good, seems that he adjust the final grading way, but the final exam is quite difficult, and one of three assignment is quite difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy, there is an exercise after each class, and need to finish three assignments, also we need to take part in a final exam.

reviews.author: tetete
reviews.comment_content:
The content is fairly good. No wonder he would use it for years.

He gave this lecture to MSBD students, using the same material as COMP 3311 (We failed to understand why he gave 2 lecture notes and 2 homework worksheets after each lecture until we found that he was giving lectures to other students twice a week).
reviews.comment_teaching: Fast slides reader.
reviews.comment_grading: Not good. Final exam is open book but it came up with many new concept and it's much more complicated than the cases he gave in the homework.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is low at the beginning of the semester while it goes up in the later weeks.

reviews.author: MighTy
reviews.title: Too much content for a course
reviews.comment_content: The content is too much for a course, before the midterm is about SQL and some basic logical knowledge on database, after the midterm is all about the physical database, indexing techniques, some other programming languages. If you can learn everything well, then you can have a really good understanding on DB system. But there's too much for a single lecture and it's really hard to get familiar with everything taught. So be careful to plan your workload when you enroll in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wilfred has basically well-prepared PowerPoint, as for the teaching, it's completely just reading the PowerPoint, I don't know if it's because Zoom teaching but it's possibly the same in the classrooms, skipping all the lectures is not recommended though, it's better to attend the lectures even you just read the PPT through without noticing what he's saying.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is not good, I think getting a good grade is pretty hard. You need to do really well on the exams and try to get full on the homeworks.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not that tough, there are four assignments, basically just some implementation on the lecture notes, so if you learn them carefully you'll be able to manage the assignment really well.
As for the exams, the problems types are almost fixed and you really need to do more practice on the pastpapers, they will have you get a good understanding on the exams.

reviews.author: wingtkw
reviews.title: Study this course in summer semester is not recommended
reviews.comment_content: ER Diagram, Relational Model, SQL, calculating page I/Os (the most difficult part of the course), Transactions
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor taught the whole course very quickly.
Basically teaching all the materials that should be taught in one week in one day.
I cannot catch up with what he said sometimes (sorry I am not a genius).
The professor and TA are happy to offer assistance when you have any problems.
reviews.comment_grading:
UST Standard.
Mean score = C+
reviews.comment_workload:
In class exercises, tutorial exercises, project tasks and labs
Not very difficult but still require some time to do (so-so).

reviews.author: ZaG
reviews.title: Nice lectures, impact but fine
reviews.comment_content: You learn a lot during lectures, not too much homeworks. But has three tasks(projects), and two tests(midterm and final). A lot of exercises during lectures and tutorials.
reviews.comment_teaching: If you go to all the lectures and listen carefully, the teaching is super good. You learn what you need to know from classes.
reviews.comment_grading: Not applicable yet. The tests are open-booked though.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is heavy. Because three tasks to be finished with two tests in about 7 weeks. The first two tasks is fine, you do some conceptual stuffs and won't take too much time. But the last would take some time.

reviews.author: krrish19
reviews.title: Great Class
reviews.comment_content: Very easy to understand. As long as you work hard and study properly you will be fine.
reviews.comment_teaching: Great teaching. The professor often reads from the slides, but is very open to further explaining the content to you if you ask him after class.
reviews.comment_grading: grading is very nice. As long as you put in the work, you will get the grade. The std for tests is very large so you should be fine.
reviews.comment_workload: workload easily manageable. Several assignments early on but it slows down after a bit and then just one big final assignment which is also very easy.

reviews.author: Pierre
reviews.comment_content:
The teacher provides a lot of documents to support his courses.
- An exercise sheet at each lecture. (+ correction)
- An exercise sheet at each tutorial. (+ correction)
- A video and the power point of each lecture.
- A lab each week.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is interesting, he tries to be interesting, relaxed and pleasant. He also is helpful and answers to questions.
The tutorials are also good.
As the course is extremely well organized and the content is well prepared, the teacher and teaching assistants just follow this timetable.
reviews.comment_grading:
A lot of things are graded during this course:
- A project of 3 tasks.
- A midterm
- A final exam
- Each exercise sheet during the courses (you get full points if you try, not if you succeed so it is kind of an attendance grade).
- Each exercise sheet during tutorial
- Each lab
-> The exercises sheets and labs are all put together to make an attendance grade of 10%.
reviews.comment_workload:
You have a lot of work to complete, but it is not really difficult. If you just come to class and do the exercises you don't really need to work at home.
The only homework you have to do is the project, which demands not too much work.

reviews.author: Jack Qian
reviews.title: Great Professor
reviews.comment_content: The first half of the semester is all about the logic and syntax about database, which is the most useful part.The second half of the semester is about data storage, structure and recovery, which makes you a greater database designer.Both part is adequate and useful.Highly recommended
reviews.comment_teaching: The best professor teaching this course.Fred will use a lot of example and graph to help you understand some abstract concept, and exercise in class adequate.However, the speed is a little bit fast, you have to do some off-class exercise to catch up his progress.
reviews.comment_grading: fair grading.
reviews.comment_workload: 3 project,  in-class exercise and difficult lab.Huge workload for summer semester, you need to pay great effort, but you will feel you really learn a lot from this course.

reviews.author: wenziqi
reviews.title: bad grade course
reviews.comment_content: The knowledge is very important ,especially in Lab , the content in lecture is help to our thinking and understanging of database.
reviews.comment_teaching: teach too fast, you can't follow the teacher, because he is flying!
reviews.comment_grading: Every time the score are provided to us and we know the score of max , min, avg , med, At last I found I was about lower than avg 5% of total grade , then I get .........C! shiiiiit.
reviews.comment_workload: homework is not much but still some. But there too much things you need to learn , so you must spend a lot of time to study it out of class.

reviews.author: Alan1214
reviews.comment_content: The course is mainly focusing on the data management, such as the SQL, pipeline. And the content will be taught in class, however, the lab is about how to use the SSH to implement SQL.
reviews.comment_teaching: For me, it is difficult for understanding some concept because I think that professor speaking too fast in some difficult concepts. So, I think self-reading is important for this course.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is fine, more accurately, I think the grade is fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Need spend many for self-reading whatever for the lecture or the labs. Although the labs are not counted in the grade, the final exam will have the special part for testing lab content, and hence, the final need to spend many many many many time for preparing.

reviews.author: Annie LI
reviews.title: Heavy one
reviews.comment_content: Very sophisticated material in the later half of the course, quite abstract for me but would be useful for people who are really interested in this field as the things are solid.
reviews.comment_teaching: There are not much people in the classroom though but as a CS minor students, I attended all the lectures trying but failed to get them across hhh but I think if some one like it enough it would be fair for them.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is okay but I do not know much about other students. I spent quite some time just to get across the materials
reviews.comment_workload: okay

reviews.author: St.KF
reviews.comment_content: Compressed content, not very clearly in some slides (like the definition of lossless). 23 slides for class, each 20~30 pages, 1 in-class exercise per class (sometimes left for homework).
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof is really nice and patient. Fast paced but I think understandable most of the time.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading for tasks is really strict but good grade overall. 10% per task, 10% for in-class exercise, tutorial exercise and lab, 20% for midterm and 40% for final.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload, open-book exam. Projects(tasks) may require some time but not much (~5 hr/task). In-class exercises are kind of taking attendance so it's suggested to take every lecture.

reviews.author: takecare
reviews.title: Killing me softly ... with this course
reviews.comment_content:
(I)Database design (E-R and relational)
(II)SQL
(III)Functional dependencies
(IV)Indexing (hashing included)
(V)SQL query optimization
(VI)Transactions

(I), (II) and (V) are very useful in practice, while the others remain at theoretical levels and are hard to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
professor tried to have us crammed with all the content which is hard to swallow throughout 1.5 month!! (I used to think he's gonna delete some content or make things easier  :( )

Poor learning environment since the heavy noise from the construction nearby the classroom for the second half of the course.

The TA is helpful and kind. She's willing to answer your problems online and offline.

P.S. The professor might also teach COMP3111 in similar fashion. It's better to go through the notes seriously before lessons.
reviews.comment_grading: NOT GOOD AT ALL. Exams are difficult. Choose another course to fulfill your elective area requirement.
reviews.comment_workload: 4 individual project assignments to complete. Some are easy but some aren't. It's interesting and fruitful to have the final boss which simulates a PHP or Google Form-like webpage using Visual Studio C# plus Oracle SQL.

reviews.author: Sungmin
reviews.title: Tough course
reviews.comment_content: Very useful stuffs to learn related to databases. Database design, SQL & inner implementations. The course contents are really necessary I guess in order to develop or contribute on projects using server network and databases(Which does not?). Without knowing the designing methods, you won't be able to design efficient databases, which will eventually cause some problems if the data grows larger.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor tries hard to reach students and make them understand the contents. He teaches well in the lecture. Also the ppts contain all contents you should know. (Maybe too much contents, the ppts have retarded number of slides.)
reviews.comment_grading: Very Bad. The contents are very important and necessary but just too hard. The mean is around 50% for both midterm and finals, but it is not easy to reach such grade.(and please know that both exams are open book exams) Study hard in order to get a good grade. Even you study hard, the exams are tough.
reviews.comment_workload: You have to finish 4 assignments. First two are easy, while the other two aren't. I want to give a C+ or B- for workload, but there's no such thing, so I'll give a C.

reviews.author: ninjaturtle
reviews.title: Easy A
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture Exercises (in class) + Tutorials + Labs - 10%
Midterm - 20%
Project (3 Tasks) - 30% (3x10)
Final - 40%

The content is pretty straight-forward and easy except for some tuple output calculations in the post-midterm topics. But lecture exercises and tutorials are plenty of practice so it's more than manageable.

Exams are open-book

Lecture attendance taken through solving the exercises at the end of every class
reviews.comment_teaching:
He reads from the slides but the slides are pretty helpful. He's always open to questions and takes the effort to explain things when he feels he's gone a bit too fast.

He also comes to the labs and will stay back to help you if you're stuck!
reviews.comment_grading:
I think if you get 0.5 sd above mean in the exams and 1 sd above mean in tasks, it should atleast be an A-

(Assuming you have perfect attendance for all the lectures, labs and tuts)

The project task means were low (~70%) cause the grading scheme is particular. You're supposed to contact the client (prof) for clarifications so just ask a lot of questions and you should be able to get ~90%
reviews.comment_workload:
No homeworks unless nobody is able to finish the lecture exercises in class. No readings required either.

The project is not that time-consuming, just pay attention to the details cause it's easy to lose marks, esp in Task 1.

I spent about 2 days before each task deadline and scored around 97% in them. The mean was low cause people started working on the day it was due. So the tasks aren't that tough but just give it atleast a day or two of attention

reviews.author: cdbn
reviews.comment_content:
这门课的主要内容:
midterm前:
- ER model
- Relational Model
- Relational Algebra
- SQL
- Functional Dependency
- 3NF, BCNF

midterm后:
- Memory Hierarchy
- Database Indexing
- Query Processing + Optimisation
- Transaction
- Concurrency Control
- Database Recovery
***我们的ppt跟很多不同大学的笔记一模一样，相信教授在做这些slides时也花了很多功夫上网参考其它大学的database课。

作为elective的课，从midterm前的SQL query到midterm后的database理论，这门课结合了大量关于database的知识。有的童鞋可能会说，midterm前学的更为practical，以后做工才可能会用到，而midterm后的都是以后不可能会用到的。我只能说，这样想的童鞋不如自己去自学SQL，相信能节省更多时间，不必花一门课、一个学期去学database。再次强调，这是一门elective课，不可能只想要进来划划水，学写一些SQL就算。这门课除了要教童鞋们写SQL之外，更多的是要provide童鞋们在database方面一个更全面的认知。

虽然有时我也不太赞同教授企图把很大量的知识都挤在一门课内教完，但我认为大多数知识都是重要、有用的，只不过会让人有些消化不过来。无论是以后想往database方向发展还是只纯粹想学学database的童鞋，都强烈推荐上这门课，感觉上读CS的人都应该要对database有不错的认识。

忠告：这门课不适合抱大腿和刷grade
reviews.comment_teaching:
只上了第一堂和最后一堂课。感觉上教授只跟着他的ppt念，所以不上课也行。然而，看得出教授很用心教课，上课时也尽量与童鞋互动，但因为内容本身就有点闷，而且教授语音也比较flat，导致最后上课的童鞋寥寥无几。

至于tutorial，只上了第一堂。好几位TA有严重口音，很难明白他们在说什么。
reviews.comment_grading:
midterm: mean 74.9，SD 18.1, highest:100
final(据说): mean 55，SD 18，highest 94.5（除去没考final的童鞋）
本人: assignment全接近满，midterm 99, final 88 —> A+

grade还算是挺不错的。至少在我所认识的人中（包括我自己），已有3个人得A+。

虽然两次考试都是open book，但这绝对不是一门适合抱大腿的课，因为materials实在太多。建议好好学习这门课，别奢望可以考前几天刷刷notes就算。
reviews.comment_workload: assignment 3和4都会比较耗时。建议找几位大神朋友一起上这门课，方便讨论答案。

reviews.author: pier
reviews.comment_content: The content of the exam is quite interesting. It's a good primer  for learning about query and relational algebra. You can learn how to design an er-schema and implement your database as well.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor does a good job introducing the subject even though he doesn't give you enough time to think on the lecture exercises. ( A couple more minutes would be great )
reviews.comment_grading:
Task 1: Mean: 86.1 High: 98.5 Low: 71.5
Midterm: Mean: 69.8 High: 92.9 Low: 27
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is not that hard and task are easy ( 30% of the grade )
Attendance is recorded.

reviews.author: Cochonnet
reviews.comment_content: 很基础 但是课程设计不错 难度曲线很平滑
reviews.comment_teaching: 基本上是念ppt所以我习惯补录像 效率会高一些
reviews.comment_grading:
给分很松，基本上沾边的答案就会给一些分数
就是考试和平时联系不太一样 很少有计算 主要是靠理解和概念
reviews.comment_workload:
每周的exercise有答案
assignment也不算难 对考试有帮助

reviews.author: Li Mingxuan
reviews.title: Really good class
reviews.comment_content: As an exchange student from mainland, comparing to my teachers back to my home institution, prof Hung, I have to say, has really done a good job. from the sallybus I can see the reasonabllity of his class
reviews.comment_teaching: really full of passion and humor. it's just that kind of teacher I like. The first class really amazed me. Long years there have been from last time I saw a teacher who could love what he is teaching so much.
reviews.comment_grading: Not finish this class yet. So .....
reviews.comment_workload: Fine, At least, for a student from mainland, I don't think the work load is too much

reviews.author: ooooooooo
reviews.title: Very good course and less workload
reviews.comment_content:
Methods and tools for planning, designing, implementing, validating, and maintaining large software systems. Project work to build a software system as a team, using appropriate software engineering tools and techniques

List of Topics
1.Introduction
2.Modeling Software Systems using UML
3.Software Development
4.System Requirements Capture
5.Implementation
6.Testing
7.System Analysis and Design
8.Software Quality Assurance
9.Managing Software Development
reviews.comment_teaching: Watch video before each lesson
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme
Pre-Lecture Quizzes 10%
In-class Practice Exercises Assignments 10%
Labs 10%
Project 30%
Final 40%
Total 100%
reviews.comment_workload: The main workload is related with the group project based on the data to develop a small software including GUI
